summary: Duke University, located in Durham, North Carolina, started in 1838 and moved to its current spot in 1892. It was renamed in 1924 to honor Washington Duke by his son, James Buchanan Duke. The university has three main campuses in Durham and a marine lab in Beaufort. It's known for its Gothic architecture and the Duke Chapel. Duke is very selective, accepting only a small percentage of applicants, and spends over $1 billion on research yearly. Many famous people have attended Duke, including a U.S. president and several billionaires.
title: Duke University
